edu.ncsu.csc216.cash_register

Class CashRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.cash_register.CashRegister

  • public class CashRegister
extends java.lang.Object
    A cash register drawer that holds a collection of currency. The currency are bills and coins. The cash register knows what collection of currency is in the drawer and it's balance.
    Author:
    SarahHeckman, Chris Bollinger (cwbollin@ncsu.edu)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CashRegister()
      Creates a cash register drawer for the start of the day

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the balance of the cash register.

      Handles a customer purchase from the cash register

    • Constructor Detail

      • CashRegister

        public CashRegister()
        Creates a cash register drawer for the start of the day

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentBalance

        public int getCurrentBalance()
        Returns the balance of the cash register. Since we are dealing with coins, we are representing our money as an int. To see the double value of the amount of money, divide by 100.00.
        Returns:
        the balance of the cash register

      • processPurchase

        public CurrencyCollection processPurchase(int purchaseAmount,
                                 CurrencyCollection payment)
        Handles a customer purchase from the cash register
        Parameters:
        purchaseAmount - amount of item(s) customer is purchasing
        payment - how much the customer has payed as a collection of the currency given to the cashier
        Returns:
        a collection of currency that is the change (if any)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the customer has not paid enough to purchase the item(s)

      • processRefund

        public CurrencyCollection processRefund(int refundAmount)
        Returns a collection of currency representing the refund
        Parameters:
        refundAmount - amount refunded to the customer
        Returns:
        a collection of currency representing the refund
